title: Student Researcher Interview
Interview Descriptions:
Great!
They call you through zoom. Ask you what you did before today. And they ask you to talk about yourself.
They ask about your resume. Your strengths and your weaknesses. 
People are nice, questions are reasonable.
Interview Questions: How organized are you at your job?

title: Recruiter Interview
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and requested that I develop and give a presentation to the admissions team followed by lots of questions as if they were prospective students and parents. it lasted about 2 hours
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you dealt with a challenging student

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Molloy College (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was normal.  Nothing strenous.  Good process.  Good people.  Small college but authentic.  Enjoyed the people.  Great students.  President is good.  Nice campus.   Actually seems like a wholesome place.  I don't know what else to say.  This thing is forcing me to write more
Interview Questions: Your basic questions related to role, skills. experience, teaching philosophy.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Molloy College (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, minimum process, not much of an interview and the manager is very friendly. They ask you why you want to tutor and how we found out about the tutoring services and what you think being a tutor means.
Interview Questions: What do you think being a tutor is?

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Molloy College (Rockville Centre, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Three levels including HR, Search Committee, Department Chair, VPAA and submit teaching evaluations. Sent in cv responding to ad on website. Answered questions from committee, VPAA and Department Chair. Submitted CV and student evaluations from previous work.

title: Work Study Interview
Interview Descriptions: overall the hiring process was simple. they asked basic questions such as time available, what year i am in, age, strength weakness, why i wanted to be hired in this position, and overall what qualitfies me to fufill this position. the ladys were great and i would love to wokr

title: General Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Molloy College (Rockville Centre, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: VP office, not as serious as one would have assumed it would be.  Job was new and they did not have a clue about what I would be taking on, was not compensated accordingly and no raises were given.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the table?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Molloy College
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in person with HR, admissions director, and 2 counselors. Was called back for a 2nd interview. Created an admissions presentation and presented to 8 admissions faculty members, followed by a brief interview.
Interview Questions: How would you work with families and students with different ideas about college?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Molloy College (Rockville Centre, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a quick process. There was only one interviewer. They were friendly and walked down my resume with me only asking one or two questions. I was accepted on the same day as the interview.

title: Work-Study Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Molloy College (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: pretty fast and easy, very simple. the lady was very nice and helpful. Answered all my questions was very honest. She showed me around the school and met everyone in the office. staff seam down to earth and very friendly. i enjoyed my interviewed and looking forward t getting hired. very excited, very excited!!! I hope i get this job

title: Molloy College Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Molloy College in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first interview is a sit down interview with about 5 current employees. They ask you the generel questions. The second interview you have to prepare an admissions presentation. You present in front of roughly 10-15 people from different departments.

title: Financial Aid Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Molloy College in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, few questions, most important to them was how much minimum salary you would accept - red flag, then panel interview, typical questions.  references were asked, and the offer was made, very low offer but job market was not competitive back then.  salary was not negotiable.  took about 3 weeks total to complete the process.
Interview Questions: panel interview, questions on qualifications, and areas of expertise.
